dt: {bc}devoid or partially devoid of light {bc}not receiving, reflecting, transmitting, or radiating light
{bc}being less light in color than other substances of the same kind
{bc}arising from or showing evil traits or desires {bc}{sx|evil||}

dt.t: the {wi}dark{/wi} powers that lead to war
had a {wi}dark{/wi} view of the future

dt: {bc}not known or explored because of remoteness
{bc}intense in color, coloring, or {d_link|pigmentation|pigmentation} {bc}not light or fair

dt.t: the theater is {wi}dark{/wi} in the summer

pt: {sc}obscure{/sc} {sc}dark{/sc} {sc}vague{/sc} {sc}enigmatic{/sc} {sc}cryptic{/sc} {sc}ambiguous{/sc} {sc}equivocal{/sc} mean not clearly understandable. {sc}obscure{/sc} implies a hiding or veiling of meaning through some inadequacy of expression or withholding of full knowledge.
{sc}dark{/sc} implies an imperfect or clouded revelation often with ominous or sinister suggestion.
{sc}vague{/sc} implies a lack of clear formulation due to inadequate conception or consideration.
{sc}ambiguous{/sc} applies to language capable of more than one interpretation.
{sc}equivocal{/sc} applies to language left open to differing interpretations with the intention of deceiving or evading.

et: Middle English {it}derk{/it}, from Old English {it}deorc{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}tarchannen{/it} to hide
shortdef: devoid or partially devoid of light : not receiving, reflecting, transmitting, or radiating light
transmitting only a portion of light
